name: The business activity risk factor for an established business

testSteps.description: Example #1: {Risk Factor=7 or above, Business Category=Casino, Risk Rating=High}

children.description: When a customer with a business risk factor of 7 or above, such as for a Casino business
And the business been operation for more than two years
Then their business activity risk rating should be High

reportData.title: Database evidence
reportData.contents:
| BUSINESS_ACTIVITY  | RISK |
| CASINO             | HIGH |
| FUNERAL DIRECTOR   | LOW  |

testSteps.description: Example #2: {Risk Factor=5 to 7, Business Category=Jewellery Store, Risk Rating=Medium}

children.description: When a customer with a business risk factor of 5 to 7, such as for a Jewellery Store business
And the business been operation for more than two years
Then their business activity risk rating should be Medium

reportData.title: Database evidence
reportData.contents:
| BUSINESS_ACTIVITY  | RISK |
| CASINO             | HIGH |
| FUNERAL DIRECTOR   | LOW  |

testSteps.description: Example #3: {Risk Factor=Under 5, Business Category=Software Development, Risk Rating=Low}

children.description: When a customer with a business risk factor of Under 5, such as for a Software Development business
And the business been operation for more than two years
Then their business activity risk rating should be Low

reportData.title: Database evidence
reportData.contents:
| BUSINESS_ACTIVITY  | RISK |
| CASINO             | HIGH |
| FUNERAL DIRECTOR   | LOW  |

userStory.narrative:
Some business activities are considered more risk-prone than others, and certain customers and entities may pose specific risks.

  The business activity risk factor for an industry is determined by the potential risk they present to the bank. For example:

  {Examples!WithTitle} High Risk

  Business activity risk for a customer with an estabilished business (in activity for 2 years or more) depends on the business activity risk factor:

  {Examples} The business activity risk factor for an established business


  The Business Activity Risk factor for a customer is determined by the industry risk factor, how long the business has been in activity. A business with less than 2 years activity is considered high risk:

  {Examples} Businesses established less than 2 years ago are considered higher risk

title: The business activity risk factor for an established business
description: Established businessess have been in activity for 2 years or more

dataTable.scenarioOutline:
When a customer with a business risk factor of <Risk Factor>, such as for a <Business Category> business
And the business been operation for more than two years
Then their business activity risk rating should be <Risk Rating>
